title: reference request - Maximum nonintersecting interval pick
body: This surely has been solved in the context of scheduling already! (Shall I ask on some computer SE instead?) Assume we have a set of closed "intervals" on $\mathbb Z$ ( $\mathbb R$ isn't different, I guess) and like to pick the maximum cardinality of nonintersecting intervals from it. I bet the obvious greedy algorithm (first throw out all intervals that completely enclose another, then pick leftmost, repeat) already gives the solution. A reference would suffice.
